content: I am a passionate Graduate software engineer who enjoys building applications, AI systems, and creative projects. I have strong skills in software development, machine learning, and backend engineering. I did research on phishing link detection during my honours year. I am currently looking for a full-time software engineering position. I am working on a personal portfolio website that includes an AI-powered chatbot.

My technical skills include JavaScript, Node.js, Python, Java, SpringBoot, Microservices, MongoDB, C++, Restful API, AWS, FastAPI, React, SQL, and working with OpenAI APIs. I am also familiar with vector databases and embedding search techniques.
I am building a personal portfolio website that includes an AI-powered chatbot. The chatbot can answer questions about me and my work by using embedding search and a backend service.
I have experience working on machine learning projects involving multi-label classification. I fine-tuned models like RoBERTa for text classification tasks on custom datasets.

metadata.description: I fine-tuned RoBERTa for multi-label classification tasks. I used Hugging Face Transformers and PyTorch for model training and evaluation. The project involved data preprocessing, model training, and performance evaluation using metrics like F1 score and accuracy.

content: I have developed a web application using React and Node.js, implementing RESTful APIs and integrating with MongoDB for data storage for final year project.

metadata.description: I developed a web application using React for the frontend and Node.js for the backend. I implemented RESTful APIs for data communication and integrated MongoDB for data storage. The project involved user authentication, data management, and responsive design.

content: I have developed secure and scalable backend services for an Insurance system. I utilized Java and Spring Boot to create a robust backend system, ensuring efficient data handling and processing.

metadata.description: I developed a secure and scalable backend system for an insurance application using Java and Spring Boot. The project involved designing RESTful APIs, implementing security measures, and ensuring efficient data handling and processing.

content: I have experience in building microservices architecture, focusing on modularity and scalability. I have worked with Docker and Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration.

metadata.description: I built a microservices architecture for a web application, focusing on modularity and scalability. I utilized Docker for containerization and Kubernetes for orchestration, ensuring efficient deployment and management of services.

content: I have worked on a project that involved integrating OpenAI APIs for natural language processing tasks, enhancing user interaction and experience.

metadata.description: I integrated OpenAI APIs for natural language processing tasks in a web application. The project involved implementing chat functionalities and enhancing user interaction through AI-driven responses.

content: I graduated from the University of Wollongong with a Bachelor of Computer Science (Honours) in Software Engineering.
You can reach me at my email: louis.yangga@gmail.com or through my LinkedIn profile: https://www.linkedin.com/in/louis-yangga/.
I am currently based in Sydney, Australia.
I am fluent in English and Indonesian. I have basic proficiency in Mandarin Chinese.
In my free time, I enjoy reading about AI advancements, exploring new technologies, and working on personal projects. I also love hiking, badminton and photography.

I have completed a Bachelor of Computer Science (Honours) with a major in Software Engineering at the University of Wollongong. I have also completed several online courses in machine learning and web development.
I am deeply interested in AI development, backend systems, vector search technologies, and building high-quality, user-friendly web applications.
I believe in building modular, efficient systems that are easy to maintain. I enjoy learning new technologies and applying them creatively to real-world problems.
